first_reading.text:
[[Os 8,4]]Thus says the LORD: They made kings, but not by my authority; they established princes, but without my approval. With their silver and gold they made idols for themselves, to their own destruction.
[[Os 8,5]]Cast away your calf, O Samaria! my wrath is kindled against them; How long will they be unable to attain innocence in Israel?
[[Os 8,6]]The work of an artisan no god at all, Destined for the flames-- such is the calf of Samaria!
[[Os 8,7]]When they sow the wind, they shall reap the whirlwind; The stalk of grain that forms no ear can yield no flour; Even if it could, strangers would swallow it.
[[Os 8,11]]When Ephraim made many altars to expiate sin, his altars became occasions of sin.
[[Os 8,12]]Though I write for him my many ordinances, they are considered as a stranger's.
[[Os 8,13]]Though they offer sacrifice, immolate flesh and eat it, the LORD is not pleased with them. He shall still remember their guilt and punish their sins; they shall return to Egypt.
first_reading.title: Book of Hosea

gospel.text:
[[Mt 9,32]]A demoniac who could not speak was brought to Jesus,
[[Mt 9,33]]and when the demon was driven out the mute person spoke. The crowds were amazed and said, "Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel."
[[Mt 9,34]]But the Pharisees said, "He drives out demons by the prince of demons."
[[Mt 9,35]]Jesus went around to all the towns and villages, teaching in their synagogues, proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom, and curing every disease and illness.
[[Mt 9,36]]At the sight of the crowds, his heart was moved with pity for them because they were troubled and abandoned, like sheep without a shepherd.
[[Mt 9,37]]Then he said to his disciples, "The harvest is abundant but the laborers are few;
[[Mt 9,38]]so ask the master of the harvest to send out laborers for his harvest."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
